Gordon Robson wrote:
> Hi Rich,
>
> Not sure what th=
e motif is, but as for the way names are read, typically the
> kunyomi is u=
sed or the Japanese pronunciation. However, even sword-smiths
> are given o=
nyomi or Sino-Japanese nicknames. Perhaps the most famous is
> Nagayoshi, w=
ho is typically called Chogi. There is also Hiroyoshi, whose
> nickname is =
Hiroga. Teimei may be a Japanese nickname for Sadanobu. I am
> pretty sure =
you would read his signature using the kunyomi. On the other
> hand, there =
are lots of fittings makers whose name is read using the onyomi
> -- Tomei,=
 Somin, all the Goto guys. Even the Omori guys' names are
> pronounced here=
 in Japan using the onyomi. I hope this is sufficiently
> confusing.
>
> Go=
rdon
